title: @Riot, next champ when?
body: It's been about 2 months since Bard's reveal. When will the next champ be revealed?

replies.body: I know there was a tweet recently that one of the devs is working on a new champ. No idea what stage that champ is in.

> [{quoted}](name=Soleka,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sfkABkt6,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-04-14T06:17:32.017+0000)
>
> I know there was a tweet recently that one of the devs is working on a new champ. No idea what stage that champ is in.

They work on like 4-8 champions at a time.

We've got 6 champs in the pipeline at the moment. Those range from pretty close to complete (next champion due out) to just started and nothing but some initial ideas about possible directions on paper.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sfkABkt6,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-04-14T07:09:25.125+0000)
>
> We've got 6 champs in the pipeline at the moment. Those range from pretty close to complete (next champion due out) to just started and nothing but some initial ideas about possible directions on paper.

Is it going to be this much delay between each from now on? This is even slower than last year. It was like 2-3 months between Rek and Bard and that doesn't seem to be changing with whoever is next.
It's very likely that, as per last year, there'll be some variance in the time between champion releases, with some shorter gaps between champions too.

This may be unpopular by some, but we have so many champs on the roster now, I wouldn't be opposed to releasing one new champ for each role per year, so 5 new champs.  Then take the extra resources to work on reworks, VUs, etc.

There was a post a while back about a lot of the more recent champs taking a lot more skill than a lot of some of the older champs.  Sure, more skill and bigger plays is a good thing for LCS, but I'm sure it would be nice to take the skill cap down for a new champ for some of the newer players (or even those with less skills/hand eye coordination).  Any work on some more...simple champs?

I'm afraid this isn't a very good game to play with poor hand-eye coordination  :(

New champs do seem to be getting an awful lot of mechanics packed into their kits lately. For newer players, I'm sure it's difficult just to remember what each champion is capable of.

I guess I am referring more to those who play bots only where the skill cap is significantly lower than pvp.  That and the point and click champs like annie or yi.  You do nothing but hover your mouse over a champ and qwer.

Idk why you're wondering about new champ releases anyway. Honestly, i'd rather see riot fix up old champs rather than introduce new ones. As you introduce new champs the older ones become obsolete, so reworking oldies as to ensure the power creep doesn't get out of hand seems like the most logical, and best thing to do for the game and its players.
As in 6 new champs or does this count updates like Poppy/Taric as well?
The champion updates are done by a different team.So no,this doesn't count updates.

I'm pretty sure that statement is true 100% of the time.
I don't really want new champions until the older roster is, for the most part, up to speed.
Rek'Sai and Bard were quite far apart. I don't imagine we will be getting a new one anytime soon.

Gnar and Azir were released within a month of each other almost.

**Gnar - August 14th, 2014
Azir - September 16th, 2014**

I remember after Gnar released, being surprised at how quickly another champion came out.

Ideally, we'd be in a good place to see a new champ every 2 months, and a champion update every 2 months.  Obviously that doesn't happen, but we could always see another quick release like Gnar > Azir.

*edit*  Kalista and Rek'sai were even closer together as well it seems (November 20th and December 11th, per league wikia)
